title: Particle placed at center of square

content.question: A particle with charge <math alttext="negative 5 microcoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mtext>5</mtext><mtext> μ</mtext><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed in the exact center of the square and then released. In what direction, if any, will it initially move?

choices.label: Toward the top of the page
Toward the bottom of the page

Toward the corner of the square with the <math alttext="negative 20 microcoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mtext>20</mtext><mtext> μ</mtext><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> particle
Toward the empty corner of the square
In no direction, because it will not move

content.answer: Toward the empty corner of the square

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
